title: UK emergency-alert system: What is it and when is the test?
description: The new government emergency-alert system will be tested on Sunday, 23 April.

title: Local elections 2023: Greens eye first council win in former Tory heartland
description: The party are hoping to gain control of Mid Suffolk district council in May's local elections.

title: Coronation cross will include crucifixion relics
description: The fragments gifted by the Pope are used in a new Cross of Wales to lead the coronation procession.

title: Biodiversity targets may be slipping out of reach - study
description: Ambitious targets to halt the decline in nature may already be slipping out of reach, research suggests.

title: Iran protests: LGBTQ community rises up
description: In a country where homosexuality is punishable by death, the community shows unprecedented defiance.

title: Ukraine's Eurovision 2023 act Tvorchi have war on their mind
description: Nigerian-Ukrainian duo Tvorchi met in a chance encounter on the street. Now they're coming to the UK.

title: Sacked CBI boss says reputation 'totally destroyed'
description: The former head of the business group tells the BBC his side of the story in an exclusive interview.

title: SNP will be in trouble without action, says Kate Forbes
description: The former leadership candidate tells the BBC voters are watching the SNP "with astonishment" .

title: Thousands of children sharing beds due to overcrowding
description: More than 300,000 children in England have to share beds with family members, analysis suggests.

title: The Papers: Starmer NHS pledge and MP anger over eco-protests
description: Calls for tougher penalties for eco-protesters and the Labour leader's pledge to reintroduce NHS targets leads several of Wednesday's papers.

title: World Snooker Championship 2023 results: Gary Wilson holds off Elliot Slessor fightback to progress
description: Gary Wilson holds off a fightback from practice partner Elliot Slessor to win 10-8 and move into the second round of the World Championship.

title: Chelsea 0-2 Real Madrid: Frank Lampard says he 'won't let players off the hook' after European exit
description: Chelsea interim boss Frank Lampard says he "won't let anyone off the hook" after Real Madrid knock them out of the Champions League to inflict another big blow in their flagging season.

title: One dead in NYC multi-storey car park collapse
description: Authorities say all the workers in the partially collapsed Manhattan building have been accounted for.

title: Wednesday's transfer gossip: Kane, Messi, Mourinho, Moyes, Mac Allister
description: Paris St-Germain want Harry Kane, David Moyes to leave West Ham, Man Utd and Liverpool lead race for Alexis Mac Allister, plus more.

title: Napoli 1-1 AC Milan (1-2 agg): Olivier Giroud's goal sends Milan into Champions League semis
description: AC Milan reach the Champions League semi-finals for the first time since winning the competition in 2007 as they see off Serie A rivals Napoli in an incident-packed game.

title: Netflix ends DVD rentals in end of era
description: The streaming giant which began posting DVDs 25 years ago will send its final disc in September.

title: Rotherham United 2-2 Burnley: Late Millers goal delays Clarets' title win
description: Burnley must wait to clinch the Championship title after being held to a draw at Rotherham United.

title: Pakistan: Lorries crushed and buried in deadly landslide
description: At least two people died as dozens of vehicles were engulfed while en route to Afghanistan.

title: Fox News settles $1.6bn defamation case with voting machine firm

title: Porsche Tennis Grand Prix: Emma Raducanu thrashed in 59 minutes by Jelena Ostapenko
description: Emma Raducanu's first clay-court match of the season ends in a one-sided defeat by former French Open champion Jelena Ostapenko in Stuttgart.

title: SNP treasurer Colin Beattie released without charge
description: The 71-year-old had been taken into custody by police investigating the party's finances.

title: Secret Service nabs toddler who squeezed through White House fence
description: The little intruder squeezed through iron bars to lead guards on a leisurely chase.

title: Ralph Yarl: Man accused of shooting black teen is in custody

title: Kate Bush song in running for top award 38 years after release

title: Six injured and school locked down over dog attack

title: Top ultrarunner Joasia Zakrzewski disqualified for using a car in race

title: Met Police use of anti-terror laws to arrest French publisher condemned

title: Former NFL player Chris Smith dies at 31

title: Cyclone Ilsa: Stranded Indonesian fishermen rescued after six days without food

title: Jamie Foxx still in hospital a week after admission

title: End racial disparities in maternal deaths - MPs
